examples: It's not a very grand house.
The wedding was a very grand occasion.
The book dares to take on grand themes in the grand manner.

meanings.def: used in the names of impressive or very large buildings, etc.
examples: the Grand Canyon
We stayed at the Grand Hotel.

meanings.def: needing a lot of effort, money or time to succeed but intended to achieve impressive results
examples: a grand plan/strategy/scheme
The gallery had its grand opening on 18 January.
New Yorkers built their city on a grand scale.

meanings.def: used to describe the largest or most important item of its kind
examples: The film won the grand prize at the Berlin Film Festival.
Tomorrow is the grand final with just 12 contestants left from the hundreds who entered.

meanings.def: behaving in a proud way because they are rich or from a high social class
examples: They're all Lord or Lady somebody or other, but they're not at all grand.
She put on her grandest air and waltzed into the living room to join the others.

meanings.def: very good or great fun; excellent
examples: I had a grand day out at the seaside.
Thanks. That'll be grand!
Fred did a grand job of painting the house.

meanings.def: used in the titles of people of very high social rank
examples: the Grand Duchess Elena
She finally learned to drive at the grand old age of 70.

meanings.def: a man who is respected in a particular profession that he has been involved in for a long time
examples: James Lovelock, the grand old man of environmental science
She finally learned to drive at the grand old age of 70.

idioms.def: a man who is respected in a particular profession that he has been involved in for a long time
